intro: Sloanea rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved sloanea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and is part of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. Sloanea rugosa is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
